revised_title: Characterization and Distillation of Bovey Coal
tldr: The author conducts experiments on Bovey coal, discovering that it primarily consists of water and that a significant amount of this principle can be separated from it using a gentle heat. The coal also contains a light oil and a volatile acid salt, which are mixed with the water that distills from it. The author compares the properties of Bovey coal to those of other types of wood and charcoal, highlighting its unique characteristics.
